alert.note: Alert for Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 03 at 9:46AM CDT until April 03 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Butler and Crenshaw. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Luverne, Georgiana, Rutledge, Glenwood, Petrey, Highland Home, Mashville, Glasgow, Daisy, Center Ridge, Wald, Pigeon Creek, Honoraville, Searcy, Moodys Crossroads, Fort Dale, Reddock Springs, Centenary and Robinson Crossroads.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
